description: Good morning, it’s Georgie here in Sydney with this morning’s top news for you...Today’s must-reads:• Misbehaving traders make ANZ clean-up tough• Consumer confidence slips• REA approaches Rightmove with takeover proposal
title: Misbehaving Traders Make ANZ Clean-Up Tough

description: President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador’s proposal to overhaul Mexico’s judiciary is now being discussed by senators, seen as the main obstacle for the approval of a plan that many consider a threat to democracy.
title: Mexico’s Senate Starts Debating AMLO’s Judicial Overhaul Plan

description: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen tested positive for Covid-19 after experiencing symptoms, a spokesperson said in a statement Tuesday.
title: Janet Yellen Tests Positive for Covid, US Treasury Says

description: A last-minute replacement of an opposition Mexican senator and allegations that another had been arrested fueled suspicion that the ruling party was moving behind the scenes to ensure it had the votes to pass President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador’s controversial judicial overhaul.
title: Mexico’s Morena Moves to Secure Votes Ahead of Reform Debate

description: Israel is still interested in normalizing diplomatic relations with Saudi Arabia and other Arab states, Economy Minister Nir Barkat said, even after plans were derailed by the Oct. 7 assault and the war with Hamas.
title: Israel Still Wants Integration With Arab States, Minister Says

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, Bloomberg Businessweek national correspondent Joshua Green explains why the Trump-Harris presidential debate is a make-or-break moment, especially for the vice president. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump and Harris Square Off at a Consequential Stage of Campaign

description: A guide to the race between Donald Trump and Kamala Harris.
title: From KHive to Project 2025, a Glossary for the 2024 US Presidential Election

description: Colombia’s capital, which has been rationing water since April and may have to re-tighten restrictions, is now also at risk of power cuts amid delays in building new transmission corridors.
title: Bogotá Adds Risk of Power Cuts to Its Months-Long Water Shortage

description: South Africa should address outstanding shortcomings in tackling illicit financial flows to exit a global dirty-money list by either June or October next year, provided there’s no surprises, National Treasury Official Ismail Momoniat said.
title: South Africa on Course to Exit Dirty-Money List in 2025, Treasury Official Says

description: Israel proposed giving Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar safe passage out of Gaza in exchange for the group freeing the hostages it holds and giving up control of the strip, a senior official said, even as doubts deepen about the two sides’ ability to reach any cease-fire accord.
title: Israel Offers Hamas Leader Safe Exit From Gaza in Bid to End War

description: Offshore wind proponents gathered in Manhattan on Monday evening to throw support — and dollars — behind Democratic presidential nominee Kamala Harris, underscoring mounting concerns about the electoral risk hanging over the nascent US industry.
title: Offshore Wind Proponents Back Harris as Political Risk Mounts

description: President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s plan to balance the budget by reaching settlements in corporate tax disputes is facing hurdles as some large Brazilian companies hold out for better deals.
title: Brazilian Companies Pushing Lula for Better Deals on Back Taxes

description: Donald Trump and Kamala Harris enter Tuesday’s debate in search of the same goal – a moment that will help them gain the edge in a race polls show is essentially tied.
title: Trump, Harris Reach for Game-Changing Moment in Pivotal Debate

description: Pravin Gordhan, who has served as South Africa’s ministers of finance and public enterprises, has been admitted to hospital, his family said.
title: Pravin Gordhan, Former South African Minister, Hospitalized

description: Colombia’s government is proposing new tax increases on wealthy individuals, gambling platforms and carbon emissions to rein in the fiscal deficit without cutting social programs.
title: Petro Plans More Tax Hikes on Wealthy Colombians and Carbon

description: When Donald Trump clinched the Republican Party’s nomination for the presidency in March, he was facing felony charges in four separate cases. Since then, the ex-president was convicted in one case, of falsifying business records, a verdict now in limbo because of a Supreme Court ruling on presidential immunity. The high court’s ruling raised questions over the viability of two more of the prosecutions against Trump — one brought by the Justice Department and another by the state of Georgia, bot
title: What’s Happening With the Trump Criminal Cases, Explained

description: Former UK Work and Pensions Secretary Mel Stride was knocked out of the Conservative leadership contest, as ex Immigration Minister Robert Jenrick topped the ballot for a second week in a row.
title: UK Tories Oust Mel Stride in Second Round of Leadership Contest

description: European defense and space companies need consolidation to better compete with major global powers, the head of planemaker Airbus SE said, echoing longstanding calls to pool resources more effectively.
title: Airbus Chief Calls for European Consolidation in Defense, Space

description: Commerzbank AG Chief Executive Officer Manfred Knof won’t seek an extension to his contract, leaving the German lender searching for a replacement at the same time as the government begins to sell its stake.
title: Commerzbank CEO Flags Exit as Germany Starts to Sell Stake

description: South Africa is preparing to file a case in a United Nations tribunal alleging that Israel is committing the crime of genocide against Palestinians.
title: South Africa to File Genocide Case Against Israel Next Month

description: Ireland just landed a challenge most countries would envy: how to spend an almost €13.8 billion ($15.2 billion) windfall that Apple Inc. was ordered to pay in taxes by the European Union’s top court. That’s equivalent of 14% of government spending this year, or some €2,700 for every man, woman and child.
title: Ireland Mulls How to Use Apple’s €13 Billion It Didn’t Want

description: It was a dark day for Apple Inc. and Google as they lost two of the biggest competition cases in European Union history.
title: Apple, Google Defeats to Fuel EU’s Crackdown on Big Tech

description: France, Germany and the UK said they would further restrict flights to and from Iran, part of a broader push with the US to punish the country over accusations it provided Russia ballistic missiles for the war against Ukraine.
title: Europe to Limit More Iran Flights Over Missile Support to Russia

description: Keir Starmer received a warning shot from his own Labour Party over the difficult battles ahead as he tries to fix Britain’s public finances, after his government suffered a significant display of dissent over his decision to scrap winter fuel payments for most UK pensioners.
title: Anger Over UK Benefit Cut Is Sign of Looming Battles for Starmer

description: On this special episode of Voternomics, we discuss whether moods are shifting around the US vice president and UK prime minister.
title: Harris and Starmer Fight to Keep the Momentum Going

description: Ukraine’s prime minister said the International Monetary Fund had urged the government to adhere to corporate standards after this month’s dismissal of the power grid chief sparked complaints by donors.
title: IMF Pushes Kyiv on Transparency After Ukrenergo Chief Ouster

description: Israel said its military probably killed an American-Turkish citizen last week by accident, prompting the US to call on its close ally to make “fundamental changes” to how it operates in the West Bank.
title: Israel Says Military Shot Dead US-Turkish Woman by Mistake

description: Since declaring himself the winner of July’s presidential vote, Venezuela’s Nicolás Maduro has been condemned by governments across the world, targeted by massive street protests and spurned by some of his closest allies.
title: Maduro Blows Through Venezuela’s Dollar Stockpile in New Threat to Regime

description: Investors weighing election risks ahead of the first US presidential debate between Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump are already a lot more jittery than they were before Trump and his onetime opponent, President Joe Biden, met onstage in June.
title: The Stocks, Bonds and Currencies Investors Are Watching During the Trump-Harris Debate

description: A Mexican opposition senator went dark on his colleagues Monday, igniting speculation that he had decided to provide the final vote President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador needs to usher through a judicial overhaul that has spooked global investors.
title: Senator’s Silence Fuels Speculation AMLO Has Reform Votes
